Some tests should not be run by default, due to their slow, and sometimes superfluous, nature.
We still want to be able to run these tests in some cases. Until now there's been no unified way of handling this. Remedy this by introducing the --all option to igt_core, and use it in gem_concurrent_blit & kms_frontbuffer_tracking.

Until now we've had no unified way to handle slow/combinatorial tests. Most of the time we don't want to run slow/combinatorial tests, so this should remain the default, but when we do want to run such tests, it has been handled differently in different tests.
This patch adds a --with-slow-combinatorial command line option to igt_core, changes gem_concurrent_blit and kms_frontbuffer_tracking to use this instead of their own methods, and removes gem_concurrent_all in the process, since it's now unnecessary.
The diffstat looks a bit scary, but that is due to the rename of gem_concurrent_all to gem_concurrent_blit.
David Weinehall (3): Rename gem_concurren_all over gem_concurrent_blit Unify handling of slow/combinatorial tests Remove gem_concurrent_all, since it is now superfluous
